body.p:
To His Excellency. Thos. E. Bramlette.
Govenor of Kentucky.

Your Petitioner Wm McQuarry a citizen of Pulaski County, had a judgment rendered against him at Sept Term 1864 of the Pulaski Circuit Court for $250. for keeping a Ga permitting gaming in his house -- He states that there were cards played in his house, not for money; but for some liquor to drink -- He states that only at one time was any card playing done in his house, and he was ignorant of the law, thinking that money had to be bet before he was liable under the Law to a fine -- He states that he is a poor man and not able to pay the fine, and ask the interposition of your Excellency to remit the same -- Sept 29. /64 --

Sworn to by W McQuarry before me this 29 Sept 1864 --
J E Cosson clk
By Wm, F, Goggins DC
We agree to the statements of the petition, and ask the Govenor to remit Mr. McQuarry fine --

I concur
B Bell
Cyrus Clark
Josiah Claunoh
Wm MCKee Fox
Wm, F, Goggin
I think it would be right to grant the prayer of the within Petition and repsectfully ask his Excy Govenor of Ky to do so.

Fon T Fox
E L VanWinkle
C B Bacheller
